fields.description: When committing my changes, after I click "Commit", sometimes the staged files window doesn't not refresh automatically, and the files are still showing. Pressing *F5* properly refreshes the page; however it was quite confusing the first time this happened, because it looks like the commit never happened for some reason.
fields.summary: Staged Files Window Doesn't Update After Commit

fields.description:
sourcetree modifies line endings in an unwanted way. i noticed this behaviour at least 6 months ago, so it's quite an old bug.

in the first round i tried to resolve it here:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/5703353/answers/9375631?flashId=362096352

repro:

i have a file in stash, that has only one hunk in it. i will attach stashed patch, and few versions of the modified file.

1) clean repository:
  $ file /d/src/lib/onExit.cpp
  /d/src/lib/onExit.cpp: C++ source, ASCII text, with CRLF line terminators
2) apply stash:
  $ file /d/src/lib/onExit.cpp
  /d/src/lib/onExit.cpp: C++ source, ASCII text, with CRLF line terminators
3) select green line
   discard green line by clicking at 'discard lines'
  $ file /d/src/lib/onExit.cpp
  /d/src/lib/onExit.cpp: C++ source, ASCII text, with CRLF line terminators
4) discard hunk
  $ file /d/src/lib/onExit.cpp
  /d/src/lib/onExit.cpp: C++ source, ASCII text, with CRLF, LF line terminators
fields.summary: sourcetree, git and line endings on windows (and visual studio)

fields.description: When looking at the log history for multiple branches, it would be very helpful to know which commit is on which branch. Could there simply be an (optional) column that displays this?
fields.summary: Have a column that displays which branch each commit is on.

fields.description:
Rename a file under source control.
Edit the renamed file's content.

SourceTree displays the renamed file and the applied changes in it's internal diff view.
BUT it is not possible to view this change in external diff viewer.
Ctrl-D option not avail and context menu entry for "External Diff" is grayed out !?
fields.summary: External diff not possible for file that has been renamed and modifed

fields.description:
Using custom action with multiple arguments separated by spaces, quoting a file/path argument.

Resulting command being executed by SourceTree contains all arguments surrounded by quotes, effectively making it just _one_ argument for the calling script/program.

SourceTree should not add those quotes automatically. Rather user has to ensure that possible spaces are quoted properly in the text entered as parameters.
fields.summary: Custom action quoting multi argument string, resulting in just one argument in the calling script/program

fields.description:
Displaying changed file in internal diff area.
Although some changed lines are longer than the visual area, no scrollbars are provided to see the rightmost end of the line(s) ?
Only vertical scrollbars are provided.
See attached screenshot
fields.summary: Missing horizontal scroll bar for long lines in internal diff

fields.description: Deleted
fields.summary: Cancelled - duplicate - sorry!

fields.description:
When you add a Stash hosted account, the "Projects to Include" list is not populated. Therefore, all repositories are loaded, and there is no option anymore to restrict it to certain proejcts.

See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: "Projects to Include" Does Not List Projects for Stash Integration

fields.description: System hangs as soon as the window is scrolled using either mouse wheel or keyboard. This does not happen with Split Window Staging.
fields.summary: App hangs after scrolling Filestatus Window when using Fluid Staging

fields.description:
I had opened stashes in the tree, then collapsed remotes in the tree, then it crashed. 

Log file attached.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed when collapsing remotes in tree view

fields.summary: SourceTree crashed after stash deletetion

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian,

SourceTree prompted me to upgrade when I opened it this morning to version 1.6.4.  I said okay.  The current version was uninstalled but the new version failed to install with the error "Key not valid for use in specified state.".

I tried to download and install SourceTree again and I got the same error.

This issue looks similar SRCTREEWIN-2055.

Help!

Thanks,
-Dave
fields.summary: Unable to install 1.6.4 due to "Key not valid for use in specified state." error

fields.description: Title says it all.
fields.summary: Double-clicked on origin and SourceTree crashed

fields.description: Remove the need of being a Windows Administrator to install SourceTree
fields.summary: Remove administrative role as a requirement to install

fields.description: Source tree crash when I change the windows to the other monitor
fields.summary: Source tree crash when I change the windows to the other monitor

fields.description:
I have SourceTree pinned to the taskbar. I launch SourceTree adn there is an update available so I choose the option to download and install it. After  installing - SouceTree is closed and restarted automatically. Now the Sourcetree icon on the taskbar is an empty document icon. The only way I have found to restore the icon is to select 'uunpin from taskbar' and add it again. 

This has happened each time I have updated the software.
fields.summary: Pinned taskbar icon disappears after update

fields.description:
After installing the software and trying to clone our Master I get a error with not real info. only completed with errors see above. there is nothing above in the memobox area. Then i tried creating a clone using other software. then when adding an existing folder i get the not a valid application for the OS error. Within all the functions in the software fetch, pull, ect. Some functions creates a fatal error. Every one in our team uses the same version of the software and I'm th eonly one with errors.

Please assist.
fields.summary: Fatal error in Application

fields.description:
Hello.
When I try to add subtree via SourceTree it hangs on fetch operation. I suppose some problems with using saved password or requesting it. Because if I use public repo it works fine.
When I do it via console everything works fine (it request user / password) and commits are in log but subtree doesn't appear in SourceTree subtrees list. So I have to push / pull via console later.
fields.summary: Subtree add hangs

fields.description: The diff menu in the stash panel doesn't do anything. I'm not sure if it's supposed to do something or not, but, in any case, it looks broken.
fields.summary: Diff menu in stash panel doesn't do anything

fields.description:
When you first set up a GitHub account in Sourcetree, after you've entered your username, you won't be able to click the OK button (it's disabled).
The button will only be enabled once the username textbox loses focus. The only way to do that is to open the "preferred protocol" dropdown.
fields.summary: Edit hosting account dialog has bad UX

fields.description: Checking for updates will tell me "Your software is up to date". Even though there is clearly a new version.
fields.summary: Update check not working

fields.description: actual version is actually 1.6.4.0
fields.summary: Collapsing "Branches" Node caused NPE and SourceTree crashed... log attached.

fields.description:
The new user interface is extremely cumbersome to use, and makes even the most basic tasks very difficult and time consuming.
Furthermore the filtering edit box is located at insane location and very far from the Working Copy window, and other windows that it affects.
The versions up to 1.5 ware extremely well designed overall, with obviously a lot of thought put in them. The 1.6 is exactly the opposite, and I have not been able to use them at all.
I am still using the 1.5.2 and will not upgrade unless there is a major UI redesign in the 1.6 version.
fields.summary: Please restore the pre 1.6 user interface. The new one is horrible at best

fields.description:
I have a file with two changes at two different positions. I go to the commit dialogue and select the first hunk to be committed. Sourcetree confirms this by showing the selected hunk as staged file and the other hunk as unstaged file. I enter my commit message and press commit.

And the, lo and behold, I have a single commit where everything is committed, even the unstaged hunk.

See screenshots for a step by step documentation what I have done.
fields.summary: When trying to commit a single staged hunk the whole file is committed

fields.description: Since file names are short and code lines are long, I always make the diff view wider to the left. However every time SourceTree refreshes the repository it resets the size of the diff view. This is quite annoying.
fields.summary: Diff view doesn't remember custom size

fields.description: After stashing changes, regardless of selecting "Keep stashed changes" option, changes are being lost.
fields.summary: "Keep stashed changes" does not work

fields.description:
As most people, I am using the Git flow methodology. My releases are named according to the version number.

Before I get to version 1, I go through a series of client releases named 0.x.y with x frequently above 10.

The issue is that the tags are sorted by alphabetical order. For version numbers it makes sens to have a special sorting that puts 0.10.0 after 0.9.0 and not after 0.1.0

This could be provided either as a setting of within the tags popup menu if you want to keep the standard alphabetical ordering.

However, using a regex against tags to match dots and order tokens separately (with left-most priority) should be a good default sorting algorithm.
fields.summary: Ordering of the tags

fields.description:
If you have any tags that begin with a hyphen e.g. "-NET4.5_Migration_Complete" then you are unable to delete the tag.

You will get this error:
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false tag -d -NET4.5_Migration_Complete
error: unknown switch `N'
fields.summary: Unable to delete tags that begin with hyphen

fields.description:
Added new Custom Action via "Options..." menu entry.
Closing options dialog after action has been entered completely.

Context menu after right click on currently modified file under git SCM control does not show any entry under "Custom Actions..." menu.

Restarted SourceTree.

Context menu after right click on currently modified file under git SCM control _does_ show newly added entry under "Custom Actions..." menu.

Same applies after editing a custom action. The edited custom action is only available after SourceTree has been restarted.
fields.summary: New/Edited "Custom Action" only effective after restart of SourceTree

fields.description: See "details" and "clone" buttons.
fields.summary: Buttons overlaping in Clone new window

fields.description:
Add the same colour circles used in the Graph against the branches tree to make it easier to determine which branch changes were made on. This will make it easier to navigate up/down the commit list and determine which branches require merging.
See screen shot of the Branch Tree on the left with the Commit Graph on the right. Basically just re-using the same circles used on the graph against the branch tree control.
fields.summary: Align Graph Tree colours with Branches

fields.description:
When committing cherry-picks with extra changes for resolving conflicts, it is considered good etiquette to reset the author so that changes that they didn't write are not attributed to them. This is done on the command-line using "git commit --reset-author".

It would be useful to have a commit option in SourceTree for this.
fields.summary: Reset author flag for commits

fields.description: Cannot create shelves
fields.summary: Shelf feature no longer enabled

fields.description: If you create a stash documents that have unix line endings change to windows line endings.
fields.summary: Stash function changes line ending

fields.description: the app crashed and i cannot launch it.
fields.summary: Launching the source tree.

fields.description:
When I stage hunks in Sourcetree and commit, instead of just the staged hunks commiting, the entire file commits!

Whats worse is that the Sourcetree UI shows only the hunks as staged, so you *think* you are just committing the hunks. However if you go to the log and look at the commit, the entire file has been committed.

This makes it all too easy to completely break code bases through unintentional commits.
fields.summary: Staging Hunks is broken in 1.6.4.0
Interacting with any checkbox in the file status area crashes the application.

fields.description:
The side/collection view of repos has some  right click features (e.g., opening explorer). It is often hard to see when you have many projects available, and many tabs, which tab goes with which repo. It would be nice if:
1. YOu could have the same right click features in the tab as the side view
2. while in a tab, the side view would synchronize (like VS) to bring you to the correct tab/view.
3. A way to save your layout on the side. I reinstall my dev box often, and have hundreds of repos. I have given up on trying to import them each time. Nice to have a serialized file to 'load' them as a view.
4. Search would be awesome. Indexed search would be nuts cool. ;-) (VS projects, node projects, repos, VS projects with a RavenDB package, node projects with npm x, etc.., I know this is crazy talk. I think I might have to go write this now. Does sourcetree have plugins.... no. OK, how about a plugin ecosystem? ;-)
fields.summary: Tabs and side view synchronization

fields.description: App crashed while viewing diffs in "Log / History" tab.
fields.summary: Crash report

fields.description: When I use the Search feature to find a commit in the distant past and then use the View in Full Log command on that commit, it takes a long time to find the actual commit in the full log, and while it is doing so there is no indication whatsoever that it is actually doing anything. If it cannot be speeded up, it should display some sort of indicator that it's actually working.
fields.summary: View in Full Log is slow and no "loading" feedback

fields.description:
At the code preview frame I have to scroll down to the end of hunk before I could see the horizontal scrollbar. It's very inconvenient when looking for config's changes (with large unwrapped strings) if the hunk is big enough.

Isn't it better to use a single horizontal scrollbar instead of several? In this case it could be always visible.
fields.summary: Scrolling code hunks horizontally.

fields.description:
Hi I'm trying to clone our repositories from GitHub. I'm getting a non descriptive error. it says see above but the ony thing above is the git command.

I have installed the latest jdk uninstalled the application ran as administrator. still no luck please assist with the issue.
fields.summary: Cloning issue while rest of the team can clone

fields.description:
Unfortunately Sourcetree (and git itself) treat files encoded in UTF-16 as binaries. It would be nice if git had native support for UTF-16.
But I can workaround that problem with my external diff viewer (WinMerge) because the file is shown as changed.

However, the file is not shown as changed in the diff window of Sourcetree (see the attached screenshot).

At least this should really be fixed.
fields.summary: Diff is marked as "Ok" even though the file is modified (for a UTF-16 file)

fields.description:
If you do not have an SSH key loaded or created and try and clone via SSH you are asked to load pageant and retry.

If you do not have a key pageant cannot load anything, so you close it and go off to puttygen to create one then go back to pageant to load it.

by the time you come back to the clone dialog it is frozen
fields.summary: If you need to generate an SSH key after initiating a clone you end up with an unresponsive Clone dialog

fields.description:
Downloading and running the 1.6.4 installer and running it missed the missing .NET 4.5 dependency.

The installer ran but when it tried to start SourceTree for the first time I got an error regarding missing .NET 4.0.
installed .NET 4.0
re-running SourceTree resulted in error for missing .NET 4.5
installed .NET 4.5. 
everything worked.

Unfortunately I've not been able to reproduce it
fields.summary: Installer did not pick up on missing pre-requisites

fields.description:
To reproduce:

Unzip the attached archive and open in SourceTree
Right-click on first commit and select "Rebase children of 076e6f7 interactively"
In resulting dialog, drag 2nd-last commit onto last. Repeat two more times.
Click OK.

Expected result: squashes the four commits into one.

Actual result: Dialog with text below; closing it says "aborting rebase"

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c "sequence.editor='C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\stree_gri'" -c "core.editor='C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\stree_gri'" rebase -i --autosquash 076e6f7dbcce1c62ad63b13b23c0edae8bb447b5
Rebasing (1/5)

error: could not apply cabeaac... Bullet for ‘push -f’

When you have resolved this problem, run "git rebase --continue".
If you prefer to skip this patch, run "git rebase --skip" instead.
To check out the original branch and stop rebasing, run "git rebase --abort".



Could not apply cabeaac66a412d0bd06ac3e0bd04c93b4aa3a13e... Bullet for ‘push -f’

Completed with errors, see above.

Note: squash can be done successfully if the commit labeled "Bullet for ‘push -f’" is first renamed removing quotes and hyphen
fields.summary: Interactive rebase squash commits with label containing 'push -f' gives "error: could not apply"

fields.description: Opened one of pom files from previous commits by  double-clicking on it. Changed content in external editor. Went back to source tree and it crashed trying to reload changes.
fields.summary: Source Tree crashed when tracking file changes

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
- Select any commit in repository
- Select one or several files in commit
- Press Ctrl+C to copy file path
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when you press Ctrl+C on file(s) in commit

fields.description:
Clicking on the "Pull" button and then looking at the log shows that SourceTree does a fetch and then a pull. This results in doing a fetch twice, because:

bq. git pull runs git fetch with the given parameters and calls git merge to merge the retrieved branch heads into the current branch.

source: [http://git-scm.com/docs/git-pull]

The extra fetch has no benefit but does take extra time.

This issue can be resolved by either:

1. Removing the initial fetch and just doing a pull.
2. Replacing the pull command with a merge. The resulting fetch + merge is exactly what pull does anyway.
fields.summary: Pull does an unnecessary fetch before pulling

fields.description: As simple as the summary discribes. Just as in almost every multi-document/tab application middle clicking on the name of the tab should close. It is much easier to use than locating and clicking at the little close button.
fields.summary: Middle click on repository tabs should close that tab.

fields.description:
Extremely annoying. Please fix :(

Also, please update the versions on this tracker. 1.6.4 is still listed under "unreleased"
fields.summary: View always switches to Log/History after commit

fields.description:
When I go into options and try to set the diff tool, everything is greyed out.

You can see from the screenshot that I set it once. I think I set it in an older version of sourceTree since upgrading to 1.6.4 (I have been through most of the upgrades since 1.5.2)
fields.summary: Unable to configure external diff tool

fields.description:
SourceTree crashed out of the blue. I was on the "Log/History" tab, but I wasn't doing anything. In fact, I was getting coffee and my computer was idling along. No dialog or anything was showing at the time. Network connectivity also appears to have gone uninterrupted.

I'll attach the log file produced by the crash.
fields.summary: Crashed

fields.description:
Dear,

I believe I currently bumped into a bug. 
I was working in the default brance for a minor project.
I was finished so i commit all my changes.
After commiting the changes Sourcetree still said that there are Uncommitted changed. When clicking on that recordset the Log/History is loaded with the comment "Nothing to commit".
Switching between commits is still possible and I currently have nothing blocking.
I logged this incident just for you guys.

In the attachement you can see what i mean.

Kind Regards,

Yves
fields.summary: Uncommitted changes when nothing to commit

fields.description:
when we have lots of repositories, we want sort these by name or other item

Update:
It will be best to have this feature on both Local and Remote Repository list
fields.summary: Support sort for the repositories list

fields.description:
With the new installer, if we update, everything is ok, however, if we install fresh, when skipping the install step to configure mercurial (since we are using an in-house git repo), the configuration does not add the 

          <setting name="EnableHgSupport" serializeAs="String">
                <value>False</value>
            </setting>

node in the user.config which causes git cloning using openssh key to give the following error:

"The OpenSSH agent is running but the server still rejected your connection.  You may need to add the correct key to your agent by selecting Tools> Add SSH key.   Please note that manually logging in with a username and password is not supported via OpenSSH.  Please either switch to a HTTPS URL or change the SSH client option to PuTTY/Plink in Tools>Options."

I am able to connect in git bash and adding that node with the false value allows me to connect successfully to the exact same repo.  This is pretty obviously a bug following the change in the way the installer allows to select which CSM  you wish to use (it seems to default to mercurial judging by the entry that is missing).
fields.summary: When installing from scratch (not update), mercurial support is on by default

fields.description:
If the credential fail and the authentication window somehow disappear to the back of SourceTree application (due to user clicking on SourceTree application) , we won't notice that there is a need to set the credential again.

This will make the user confuse that SourceTree is not working with the repository server.

The authentication window should appear in front of SourceTree application and should not disappear to the back of SourceTree application.
fields.summary: Authentication window should appear in front of SourceTree application

fields.description: The application crashed and told me to report this with the log file.
fields.summary: Crash report

fields.description: I was trying to clone a new repository. I had typed in what I thought was the correct URI for the repository in the form ssh://user@server_ip:repository. When I left the field, the program seemed to try to validate the address and then crashed before finishing.
fields.summary: Crash when trying to validate a git server address.

fields.description:
I used to run version 1.5.2 with no problem. Later i ran an update to 1.6.4 which ran good for a day. But since then it keeps crashing.

even after running a repair and uninstalling and reinstalling it keeps crashing...
I reverted to 1.5.2 but even that version is crashing. This is what the log says during the last 1.5.2 crash.

2014-09-15T15:12:20: Fatal error: 
System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for 'System.Xml.Serialization.CodeGenerator' threw an exception.

fields.summary: Sourcetree keeps crashing
Missing Reverse Hunk on newly changed files

fields.description: See attached screenshot. The dialog that asks for confirmation when adding or removing files doesn't scale well with large number of files. The buttons to interact with the dialogs end up off-screen.
fields.summary: Confirmation dialog scale out of screen when list of files is too long

fields.description:
Add a new button "show origin of this line" to the right click menu of the staging area fragment/view. The button will show a commit which was the origin of a selected line.

See similar functionality in gitk (right-click -> show origin of this line).

I use this feature a lot and unfortunately I have to open console and gitk to use it:-) Perhaps there are a lot of people like me.
fields.summary: Add a new button "show origin of this line"

fields.description:
Requested on AAC: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/194001/visual-studio-integration

Technically should be both platforms if we were to do something like this.
fields.summary: Visual Studio Integration with SourceTree

fields.description: While clicking on 'File Status' inside a Hg repository, SourceTree crashed. Can't seem to reproduce this.
fields.summary: Crash when clicking on 'File Status'

fields.description:
Ever since the UI got an overhaul, SourceTree randomnly crashes when reviewing code before staging it. 
This happens a lot, so much that it makes working with SourceTree impossible.

Here are the timestamps i collected so far:

fields.description:
When opening 'Hosted Repositories' I'm getting the following message 3 times (also see attachment):

{noformat}
Login failed for your GitHub account.

The remote service said: 'Unable to cast object of type 'System.String' to type 
'System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2[System.String,System.Object]'.
{noformat}

All my GitHub repo's do show up in the 'Hosted Repositories', no repo is missing. 

I can't remember which version, but this worked without errors before.

My account on Github is [jerone|https://github.com/jerone].

Maybe related; I'm part of the organization [OpenUserJs|https://github.com/OpenUserJs] which has 3 repo's.
fields.summary: Login failed for your GitHub account.

fields.description:
I upgraded to 1.6.4 this morning and then tried to stage a hunk out of a file (as opposed to staging the whole file). The UI showed me the separation between the staged hunk and the unstaged hunks, but when I went to commit, the entire file was committed instead of just the staged hunks.

Rolling back to 1.6.3 does not have the aforementioned behavior and can successfully commit hunks out of a file instead of the entire file.
fields.summary: Staging hunks out of a file is broken in 1.6.4.0

fields.description: ST crashes after adding password in CHANGE PASSWORD dialogue when adding stash repo. THis happens if you fail to put the scheme in the url. I guess I resolved it myself so you can go ahead and close this.
fields.summary: sourcetree crashed when adding stash repository

fields.description:
The commit UI in particular has become horribly sluggish over the last few versions. for example, on a fairly small repository (https://bitbucket.org/kfsone/tradedangerous/), it now takes upto 10 seconds from clicking the "commit" button at the branches/master view to actually getting any kind of display.

It can then take upto 10 seconds to switch files, and since the UI continually resets selections, you wind up twiddling your thumbs a lot.

I'm sending this because I just caught myself using git gui rather than waiting for sourcetree to update.
fields.summary: Horrible performance

fields.description:
When you clone a repo ,you see a logscreen with this kind of info :
Checking out files:  61% (232/379)   
Checking out files:  62% (235/379)   
Checking out files:  63% (239/379) 
But it doesnt auto scroll to the newest line.
fields.summary: Log screen should scroll automaticaly to newest line

fields.description:
In the commit panel "Push changes immediately" label, SourceTree is displaying my branch name as "origin/bugfix/FA-5450ancient_recents" when the actual name is "origin/bugfix/FA-5450_ancient_recents"

It always removes an _ in the branch name after the Jira id.

The push actually works, so it seems to just be a display issue.
fields.summary: Incorrect branch name in commit changes immediately label

fields.description:
half copy of git repository directory.. incomplete
open directory in ST
-> message: repos corrupted

working with the dir outside of ST (git clone from some remote)
ST exception
fields.summary: instability when opening directory containing corrupted repository

fields.description:
My latest operations :
- stash my work. I also have untracked files.
- pull from master and observe that it takes some time, by opening details window I see it runs "git gc".
- I think I also pushed.
- go to my stashes, delete an old stash, and want to apply the stash I just created before pulling. Then it crashes with stack trace below. It seems to be a refresh issue (refresh is a bit slow because so many diffs refresh every time you're doing something, by default).

fields.summary: Null reference exception in FileStatusRootViewModel.RestoreSelection()

fields.description:
The discard lines button is gone with the wind.

Sometime it appears and sometimes not.
fields.summary: No Discard Lines Button

fields.description:
I think it would be useful to see the column guide in more places, for example in the editor from interactive rebase and even in the log.

Also, it would be nice if the guide could be at 50 chars for the first line, as the 50/75 rule is quite well used. And the second line could be grayed out to show it should be left empty.

Actually, maybe you could add a way to use custom validators for the commit messages?

[I mistakenly created this as a support ticket, STSP-1333]
fields.summary: improve column guide for comments

fields.description:
Currently one can only choose to enable/disable the full console log for all commands. I find it useful only for some of them, like commit (because I may have a hook that prints warnings) and for the other commands it just requires  one more click on the "close" button, every time.

Would it be a good idea to be able to enable the console output only for certain commands?
fields.summary: show full console output only for some commands

fields.description:
The stash is a very useful feature of git and saves the work in Progress so on my opinion it should be moved to the top so I can have an eye on it. If there are a lot of branches or tags the stashes are out of scope.

Alternativly you could add the possibility to drag and drop the root items in the tree view so every one can create his own order.
fields.summary: Move stash in the tree view between file status and branches or ...

fields.description: An approvement of useablity it would be if a stash could be applied by double click on a stash in the tree view.
fields.summary: Apply a stash by double click

fields.description: While working on a task or story, we need to include a reference to the Github, JIRA or TFS issue. It would be nice if the commit window (the one with the commit message, options and such) allows you to setup a default message that is automatically appended in the commit message. I would prefer a second line in that same toolbox so that you can easily change the default if you suddenly need to commit on a different issue number. It should also be a per-repository setting.
fields.summary: Allow setting a default commit message next to the commit toolbox

fields.description: when i commit it always refresh , i can't type normal
fields.summary: auto refresh every time

fields.description:
If an error message appears when staging a file, the error message dialog won't go away.  I need to either close the Repo tab, or close SourceTree.  This is frustrating since I lose my commit message.

STEPS:
1) click Working Copy
2) have some files in Unstaged
3) click on a file in Unstaged and contrive an error message to appear.
4) observe error message dialog. E..g
>>>
   fatal: Unable to create 'C:/dev/Space/Main/.git/index.lock': File exists.
   If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git process is running and remove the file manually to continue.
   Completed with errors, see above.
<<<
5) try clicking on the Close button
6) observe it doesn't do anything
7) observe all the repo action buttons are greyed out

EXPECTED
6) Close makes the error message go away

NOTE ON MAKING ERROR HAPPEN:
I get the "index.lock" error or other errors pretty easily in a couple of different circumstances.
1) a file that another process has locked
2) clicking on multiple files in the Unstaged area before waiting for them to finish

In fact, for case #2 it's arguably another bug. SourceTree is pretty unstable and if you click on a second file while it's still staging the first file, you get an error message.
fields.summary: Repo tab unusable if an error message appears

fields.description:
I often find myself have to open and update numerous local repositories to update all of our different dependencies and framework libraries. This can get to be really tedious and often error prone, e.g. I'll think I've pulled and updated a repository, but I actually did it on another machine or in another folder (because of the nature of our platform product, I often have numerous copies in different folders).

I'd love to be able to say pull and update everything in this SourceTree folder (which contains multiple repositories in separate folders on the hard drive) and get a report on completion letting me know of any merges, multiple heads, etc., that were encountered during the update.
fields.summary: Pull, update, fetch, etc., a group of local repositories

fields.description: If I want to create an annotated tag (with a message) it would be nice if the existing text control would be replaced by multiline text control so I can format the tag message with line breaks and so on.
fields.summary: Multiline text control for creating a annotated tag message

fields.description:
I'm the sysadmin for our company's Rhodecode server, which serves Mercurial repos internally.  Recently, I've seen a pattern where full clones of some SourceTree users' managed repos are happening every ten minutes (or whatever their programmed interval for update checking is).  I installed SourceTree myself with some simple testing and was not able to replicate the issue.  I couldn't find any existing bugs for this.

I'm hopeful there's a configuration issue going on here, but each of these users say they never touched the installer.  They also tried both the bundled hg and a recent system hg app, neither working.

I've classified this as major, as we noticed that in the last month, one user accounted for 40% of our mercurial traffic (1.2TB total traffic).  If we were using a hosted solution, we'd be paying quite a bit for that kind of bandwidth.
fields.summary: Doing full remote clones every X minutes

fields.description:
- I had a repository open in SourceTree.
- I made modifications to the codebase externally (updating nuget packages from VisualStudio)
- I returned to SourceTree and noticed that no pending file changes listed in 'Unstaged Files' window
- Clicked 'Unstaged Files' checkbox
- Crash.
fields.summary: SourceTree crash with open repo and modifications performed externally

fields.description:
I've been so much used to this as this count has been wrong since forever, but finally a bug report.

See the PNG screenshot at https://copy.com/Q2zU94WOLefEMSjo

Almost always, SourceTree is off in the count of pushes or pulls required to make local up to date with remote.

Both for Git and Mercurial.
fields.summary: SourceTree is usually wrong in the number count of push or pulls to do

fields.description: I was in the Log view, for a Git repository. Within the list of modified files, I double-clicked a file to open it externally (the file was added in the selected revision, if that matters). Windows had no file association for the file's extension, and opened the "Choose what program" dialog. At that point, SourceTree crashed. Attached a log transcript for the time of the crash.
fields.summary: Crash when opening a file with no Windows file association

fields.description:
I think it would be a great feature to have custom buttons that we could assign aliases to.  In our git workflow there are aliases that we use for custom pushes and commits according to what type of project it is (application, website, website with a CMS, etc).  Rather than having to run in the terminal every time, it would be great if we could just assign a custom button the alias and then just click the button.
Our less experienced devs get skid-dish in a terminal window.  It would just take down one more obstacle to get everyone on board with the workflow.
thanks.
fields.summary: Buttons for Aliases

fields.description: When the "Amend latest commit" option is selected in the Commit window, the prompt asking "Do you want to replace the commit text..." should be skipped if the current message is empty.
fields.summary: Amend commit prompt for replacing message should be skipped if current message is empty

fields.description: Occasionally, the "Stage Hunk" buttons will be missing from the staging view.
fields.summary: Stage Hunk button missing

fields.description: Files that were just committed will still appear in the staging area.
fields.summary: Previously committed files still appear in staging area

fields.description: When I stage a single line of code in a file and then commit, the whole file will be committed instead of just the selected line.
fields.summary: Whole file committed instead of staged lines

fields.description: The first time the file list is loaded in fluid mode the buttons to stage/unstage/discard are not shown.
fields.summary: Stage/unstage/discard buttons don't display in fluid mode upon initial load

fields.description: When an item (or multiple) has been selected in the file status view, the only way to deselect it is by clicking a different item, or ctrl+clicking on the item again. I really expect the item to be deselected when clicking the empty region in the list (see attachment). This becomes especially annoying when there is only one item.
fields.summary: Clicking outside items should deselect in file status view

fields.description:
I've got a butt-load of repositories now - and finding them can take longer than i wish. It would be really handy if there was a sort of search box - toolbar thingy above the tree that would filter the tree based on the search critiera. So as i type in my repo name/folder name the tree is reduced so i can quickly find my the repo i'm after.

Oh, you're going to do that in the next release? You're awesome ;) (lol)
fields.summary: Add search feature to tree pane

fields.description:
I have added new files to my working folder and they don't show up in the Uncommitted changes in SourceTree.

Changed files are showing as expected, but no new files.
fields.summary: New files not listed in Uncommitted changes

fields.description:
make some changes to a file.
stage some of those changes (the diff view sometimes doesn't refresh).
commit the staged changes.
- all changes to the file are committed.
fields.summary: committing selected changes from a file results in all changes from a file being committed

fields.description: Unable to change default protocol from HTTP for Stash hosted repositories.  Similar request has been made for the MAC edition (SRCTREE-2072).
fields.summary: Allow protocol option for stash hosted repo

fields.description: Selecting all files with Shift+Mouse left click to see all changes in commit. Scroll over diff view windows or keep move focus over the file list, doesn't matter. Now try to select single file to see the difference with single mouse click - not working. Switching between repositories or double clicking to open the file seems to undo hanging application from this selection freezing.
fields.summary: Selecting single file after selecting all files is not working
